|Title=Know the definition of thrombotic microangiopathy syndrome

|Order=2}}

The MAT syndrome meets a biological definition combining :

* haemolytic anaemia (collapsed haptoglobin, elevated LDH), mechanical type (presence of schizocytes);
* consumption thrombocytopenia;
* associated with one or more organ dysfunctions.


Histologically, it corresponds to the thrombotic microangiopathy lesion.

question.title: What are the key components of the MAT syndrome?

option_a.title: Haemolytic anaemia and thrombocytopenia
option_a.description: A combination of anaemia and low platelet count

option_b.title: Haemolytic anaemia and organ dysfunction
option_b.description: A combination of anaemia and organ damage

option_c.title: Thrombocytopenia and organ dysfunction
option_c.description: A combination of low platelet count and organ damage

option_d.title: Haemolytic anaemia, thrombocytopenia, and organ dysfunction
